label: 地子
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Levied on rice fields by the government when such were not sustenance rice fields (kubunden ), but were being rented by farmers and tilled by them in addition to their regular kubunden. Also levied by Lords of Manors (Ryōshu) on rice fields tilled by villeins (yoriudo) as renters. [口分田、領主、寄人]
